summary: This bill, the Combating Racist Teaching in Schools Act (CRT Act), aims to prohibit federal funds from being awarded to schools that promote specific race-based theories. These theories include the inherent superiority or inferiority of races, the fundamental racism of the US, and the determination of individual worth based on race. The bill defines "promote" and includes stipulations about protected speech, access to materials for research, and contextual education. It applies to elementary, secondary schools, and institutions of higher education.
